alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Hanover; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, Chesterfield, City of Richmond, Hanover and Henrico. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 243 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Standing water has been reported on Interstate 95 in the City of Richmond. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area during the next hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richmond, Downtown Richmond, Virginia Commonwealth University, Virginia Union University, University Of Richmond, Bon Air, Tuckahoe, Highland Springs, Mechanicsville, Lakeside, East Highland Park, Bensley, Laurel, Glen Allen, Bellwood, Greendale, Dumbarton, Montrose, Chamberlayne and Richmond Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Hanover; Henrico
